intro: Chaerophyllum eynense, commonly known as the Eyne cow parsley, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant features finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels. It thrives in rocky or alpine environments and is often found in high-altitude meadows. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native habitat.
